title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 69-3.6 - Responsibilities of health care providers providing follow-up care for newborn children of women with a positive HBsAg test result
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 69-3.6 - Responsibilities of health care providers providing follow-up care for newborn children of women with a positive HBsAg test result

State Regulations

Health care providers providing follow-up care for newborn children of women with a positive HBsAg test result shall arrange for follow-up immunizing doses of hepatitis B vaccine to be administered one and six months or one, two and twelve months after the first dose. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
§§
69-3.6

Amended

New

York State Register November 13, 2019/Volume XLI, Issue 46, eff. 11/13/2019

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
